definition: gate/door/CL:扇[shan4]/gateway/doorway/CL:個|个[ge4]/opening/valve/switch/way to do something/knack/family/house/(religious) sect/school (of thought)/class/category/phylum or division (taxonomy)/classifier for large guns/classifier for lessons, subjects, branches of technology/(suffix) -gate (i.e. scandal; derived from Watergate)

sentences.english: So far as English composition is concerned- prair conditionertice is the proper way.
sentences.chinese: 就英语作文而言，练习是最好的门径。

sentences.english: Yes. Because you can't have a relationship with a man you've never laid eyes on.
sentences.chinese: 有啊，因为没门径和一个没看过的发展任何关系啊。

sentences.english: Hence the praetorship remained as the portal through which the sons of senators could enter the Senate.
sentences.chinese: 不过担任财务官仍旧是元老后代进入元老院的门径。

sentences.english: We gain knowledge by reading, by reflection, by observation or by practice.
sentences.chinese: 求知门径颇多，或阅读或思考或观察或实践。

sentences.english: The door to knowledge is study.
sentences.chinese: 通向知识的门径是学习。

definition: from the main room, enter the inner chamber (idiom)/to go to the next level/to attain a higher level
to enter the Way/to become a Daoist
to be unable to get in/to fail to find a proper approach to handling sth
pinyin: bu4 de2 qi2 men2 er2 ru4

definition: gate to enlightment (Buddhism)/Buddhism/way/method/(old) south gate of a palace
to understand/to comprehend the ultimate essence of things (Buddhism)
lit. to reach the main room and enter the chamber (idiom)/fig. to gradually attain proficiency/to attain a higher level
junior scholar or pupil in imperial China
hole/opening/orifice (of the human body)/(fig.) key (to the solution of a problem)
